revised_title: Astronomical Observations in the Austrian Netherlands
tldr: In this article, Nathanael Pigott shares his astronomical observations made in the Austrian Netherlands in 1772 and 1773. He determined the latitude and longitude of various locations using observations of the Sun, stars, and moons. Pigott also measured the positions of towns and made adjustments for timekeeping, such as accounting for the difference between local time and Paris time. His work contributed to the understanding of geography and timekeeping in the region.
